title.narrative: She Leads Uganda: Advancing the Voices of Girls and Young Women in Uganda.

description.narrative: The project need was identified through the gaps in the context analysis but more importantly in consultations held with GYW. Some of the barriers that GYW mentioned included but not limited to;cultural practices that play a major role in perpetuating gender inequalities, ages of GYW considered young with no value, being a girl creates room for insufficient audience, lack of knowledge on policy issues makes it difficult to front our issues and lack of mentorship and linkages to the right spaces all contribute to the critical need for this project to amplify GYW voices.

title.narrative: 20 GYW Oganisations will be trained in advocacy skills during quartely engagement meetings which will boost their capacity to make informed decisions while choosing their representation at the National Girls Advocacy Desk.

description.narrative: 20 GYW Oganisations will be trained in advocacy skills during quartely engagement meetings which will boost their capacity to make informed decisions while choosing their representation at the National Girls Advocacy Desk.

title.narrative: Number of GYW organisations trained in advocacy skills

description.narrative: Number of GYW organisations trained in advocacy skills

comment.narrative: 20 representatives of GYW led organizations were trained in advocacy skills and from the participants, two GYW were selected to participate in the TdH-NL training in advocacy to further build their capacity. Other activities halted to prevent the spread of Covid;

Under this output,the budget overspend happened because of the CSO coaching & mentorship and Bi-Annual Reflection meeting which had not been done in QRT 2 and were carried forward to QRT 3. However, GYW Conference,Support to existing coordination coalition and the National stakeholder's dialogues were, carried over to QRT4 as part of the activities to mark the IDGC explaining the understand under those particular lines;

title.narrative: 270 community members reached through quartlert support of GYW,boys and community debates

description.narrative: 270 community members reached through quartlert support of GYW,boys and community debates

title.narrative: Number of community members (disagregated by gender,age and type) reached by advocacy campaigns to support GYW challenge negative social norms

description.narrative: Number of community members (disagregated by gender,age and type) reached by advocacy campaigns to support GYW challenge negative social norms

comment.narrative: For this output to be achieved, we had to identify community gatekeepers such as religious leaders, local leaders and cultural leaders. We were already in the initial stages of doing this before the covid lockdown with its related restrictions came in place. Currently we are working out a plan to engage with them virtually.;

Under this output, the budget overspend is due to the balances on Orientation of boys & Men, Quarterly support to GYW with boys & men whose funds were carried forward from Quarter 2 and utilized in Quarter 3, explaining the over target and overspend;

title.narrative: 30 Government officials reached through engagements with MoGLSD,Parliamentary Committes,District and KCCA officials and through participation in review processes

description.narrative: 30 Government officials reached through engagements with MoGLSD,Parliamentary Committes,District and KCCA officials and through participation in review processes

title.narrative: Number of national government officials reached by L&A on importance of GYW participation in political institution

description.narrative: Number of national government officials reached by L&A on importance of GYW participation in political institution

comment.narrative: For this output,the over target occurred due to the strategy used for mobilizations through the support of the high level structures to mobilize the the relevant stake holders deemed fit for the activities who ended up invited more people to attend the engagements. The under-spend experienced in this output is attributed to the Pr-event and Events timing activities as the resources meant for use in those activities were targeted to support activities geared towards the commemoration of the IDGC(International Day of the Girl). However, the over overspend on the engagements of GYW in review processes of SDGs &UPR was due to the fact that we had to support with the facilitation of the consultant who led the consortium in development and submission of the she leads independent UPR Report.;

We conducted Prepping of children for the children's parliament prior to the commemoration of the day of the African Child. 2 were selected to represent youth issues on the round table discussion held on that day-of the Africa child-16th June 2021, to which we facilitated the children’s participation as well. We also engaged in Preparing for the newspaper pullout published for the consortium in commemoration of DAC, and in UPR processes under the youth cluster where we participated in a training on the reporting processes and in preparation of a one pager capturing issues of GYW for submission to the convening and vice convening partners. The implementation of the other activities under this output were disrupted by the unforeseen Covid restrictions put in place in the quarter.;

description.narrative: Number of GYW from diverse backgrounds who participate and are supported by She Leads interventions at the alliance and country levels

comment.narrative: We used an open system during the mapping process that could accommodate GYW from diverse backgrounds . We as well mapped out a CSO that works with the differently abled children (inclusion support Uganda). When we were asked to bring two GYW representatives for the project launch, we included one (Clare) who lives with disability;

title.narrative: Lobying and Advocacy through the use of Media( print,magazines,newspaper pullouts,fliers), traditional media(radio and TV stations) and social media (instagram,facebook,twitter,Youtube)

description.narrative: Lobying and Advocacy through the use of Media( print,magazines,newspaper pullouts,fliers), traditional media(radio and TV stations) and social media (instagram,facebook,twitter,Youtube)

title.narrative: Number of L&A campaigns (including media) conducted

description.narrative: Number of L&A campaigns (including media) conducted

comment.narrative: We were not in position to carry out the activities leading to the achievement of this output because we had envisioned to tackle media advocacy as a collective movement. This necessitated the orientation and training of CSO partners and GYW in media advocacy. Shortly after the trainings, the Country was put under a total lockdown and movements were restricted. Currently we are exploring ways of carrying out these engagements virtually;

title.narrative: Power dynamics: Partnership relations in the She Leads consortium are valued as being 'deciding' (partners make final decisions).

description.narrative: Power dynamics: Partnership relations in the She Leads consortium are valued as being 'deciding' (partners make final decisions).

title.narrative: PD.1 Number of partners that feel that in the She Leads consortium partners make final decisions

description.narrative: PD.1 Number of partners that feel that in the She Leads consortium partners make final decisions

comment.narrative: We haven't had any review meeting or engagement yet to find evidence to this .Though healthy relations and teamwork has been evidenced in all the activities we have carried out as a consortium;

title.narrative: Safeguarding: Safe involvement to the She Leads Programme is ensured for project target groups and an enabling environment is created.

description.narrative: Safeguarding: Safe involvement to the She Leads Programme is ensured for project target groups and an enabling environment is created.

title.narrative: Percentage of GYW involved in the programme who have knowledge, access to and trust in the reporting mechanisms to report safeguarding concerns

description.narrative: Percentage of GYW involved in the programme who have knowledge, access to and trust in the reporting mechanisms to report safeguarding concerns

comment.narrative: All the girls and young women were taken through the child protection and safe guarding policy and they are aware of their rights and where to run to in case of discontentment . We have a child safeguarding focal person at GUIU and we have always ensured that she attends and facilitates the sessions on child safeguarding in all our trainings;

title.narrative: She Leads partner organisations will support 20 GYW groups to build their capacity in advocacy through training,coaching and mentorship, binanual reflection meetings

description.narrative: She Leads partner organisations will support 20 GYW groups to build their capacity in advocacy through training,coaching and mentorship, binanual reflection meetings

title.narrative: Number of GYW groups supported by She Leads partner organsations

description.narrative: Number of GYW groups supported by She Leads partner organsations

comment.narrative: For this output, the budget overspend was due to the balance carried forward from Quarter 2 on Quarterly Engagement meetings for GYW led groups which was utilized in Quarter 3;

Together with the adult led CSO partners, we mapped out 4 GYW led groups from the five divisions of Kampala making a total of 20 GYW led groups. They were oriented and trained in different areas including; relevant information about the project, child safeguarding policy and practice, advocacy, feminism principles, Introduction to budget and budgetary processes. We shared with them the objectives of the project and a relationship was built with them. The quarterly engagement meeting and formation of the National girls desk have been delayed beyond this quarter due to Covid outbreak.;

title.narrative: Sustainability: Lasting results of the She Leads programme that goes beyond its implementation

description.narrative: Sustainability: Lasting results of the She Leads programme that goes beyond its implementation

title.narrative: Number of She-Leads interventions that have been adopted or scaled up in a country

description.narrative: Number of She-Leads interventions that have been adopted or scaled up in a country

comment.narrative: The project has brokered networks and linkages with CSOs and GYW. Through capacity building and mentorship, we believe this will harness their connection, hone their skills in lobbying and advocacy and ultimately create a strong movement. The movement will continually speak truth to power to decision makers/Government officials regarding the participation of GYW in public spaces even beyond the project.;

title.narrative: Traditional,local and religious leaders reached through orientation meetings and trainings to be able to demistify discriminative norms

description.narrative: Traditional,local and religious leaders reached through orientation meetings and trainings to be able to demistify discriminative norms

title.narrative: Number of local leaders reached by L&A on importance of GYW participation in political institutions

description.narrative: Number of local leaders reached by L&A on importance of GYW participation in political institutions

comment.narrative: 30 community leaders (local, cultural, religious) were reached through a 2 day orientation meeting. This was one of the activities that was not implemented in quarter 2 due to COVID19 related limitations. In this quarter, the activity was conducted online,explaining the low expenditure as online meetings are cheaper.(The balances are to be used by the community leaders to reach out to their areas to carry out sensitization on negative gender norms in November;

We were not able to implement activities that would contribute to the realization of this output due to the abrupt measures put up by the government to curb the then increasing cases of COVID19 which restricted public gatherings followed by a total lockdown .However, we are adopting to the new norm of virtual training where possible and we hope to pull off all these activities in the first half of this quarter(quarter 3);
